head.title: Credit 'Splendid Little War' to John Hay

hedline.hl1: Credit 'Splendid Little War' to John Hay

Contrary to Philip S. Foner (letter, June 11), it was Secretary of State John Hay, not Theodore Roosevelt, who called the war with Spain "a splendid little war." Hay wrote to Roosevelt, July 27, 1898:
"It has been a splendid little war, begun with the highest motives, carried on with magnificent intelligence and spirit, favored by that Fortune which loves the brave."

By whatever name we may call the war of 1898, the members of the Theodore Roosevelt Association, a historical society and public service organization that numbers more than 2,000 members worldwide, hope to celebrate in 1998 the centennial of the liberation of Cuba in Cuba in concert with Cubans freed from Communist tyranny. JOHN A. GABLE Executive Director Theodore Roosevelt Association Oyster Bay, L.I., June 27, 1991
